metadata.title: CVE-2022-25643 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
seatd-launch in seatd 0.6.x before 0.6.4 allows removing files withescalated privileges when installed setuid root. The attack vector is auser-supplied socket pathname.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25643` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libseat1 - 0.7.0-5
seatd - 0.7.0-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: seatd package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.0-5').
